data.name: Directive Nine
data.description:
Directive Nine is a VR FPS Roguelite in a sci fi setting
*EARLY ACCESS*

"How is the Galactic Federation ever going to expand with these pesky settlers in the Outer Reaches?
Agent, get out there and deal with it for us. Yes, deal with it. You know what I mean.... You know.... It's....I'm talking about destroying them....Like, dead dead."

* Roguelite with great replay value.
* Choose your loadout.
* Modify your loadout with perks
* Battle through space stations and see gorgeous space vistas.
* Outplay your enemies with your tactical awareness and superior loadout.
* Face increasingly more challenging enemies.
* Expand your arsenal of weapons and tech gadgets.
* Modify your weapons to suit your play style.
* Arsenal unlocks carry over into your next play through after you die.

changelog.change_log:
Update 0.2.3 patch notes

New:
- Added custom reverb audio per room for more realistic audio. (Expect tweaks to this in the future)
- New model for Loot crates (they were using an Ammo Box model, which is confusing because they mainly drop Credits)
- Loot Crates can now drop Health in addition to Credits. 
- WeaponModStation (Chest with "?" over it) UI now rotates to face the player.

Bugfixes:
- Fixed issue where enemies would sometimes never die.
- Fixed issue where rooms visually disappeared and infinite space was visible.
- Fixed issue where sometimes you could drop the pistol and no longer continue your run
- Fixed issue where enemies could shoot through door frames
- Fixed Shield hand position when in Lefty mode.
- Fixed reload button in Lefty Mode
- Fixed issue where sometimes there would be invisible walls blocking you.

* Reduced App Size greatly (stripped arm32 arch)
* Proper Pause handling when opening the Universal Menu
* 14 (!) new Rooms
* 1 New enemy : SpiderBot
